result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1 as charged; DRI the balance in 15CF696. DRI 15CF511.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
For defendant from Oshkosh Correctional Institution for JT 03-22-2016
For Defendant to come from Dodge Correctional Institution to court on 03-18-2016 AND 03-22-2016 at 1:30 PM

Final pre-trial at 03-18-2016 09:00 am.
Jury trial at 03-22-2016 01:30 pm.

Defendant Allen Cook appeared by speaker phone from Dodge Correctional with attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger in court. Antoinette Rich Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Requesting another jury trial date. This is now ADA Rich's case and ADA Jensen had a conflict.
Def- Requesting this matter be dismissed. This is the 3rd adjournment and it has been 238 days since the demand for speedy trial was filed. 
St- Requesting another trial date.
BTC: Adj. Will do a written decision on the dismisal.
  Jury trial scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
From ATTY Scheidegger re: information regarding ADA on case.
filed by Atty Scheidegger.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

** AMENDED 11/17/2015: Must reside at 3306 Lasalle Street Racine, WI. No drugs or alcohol with ZCI to monitor also placed on GPS monitoring. May leave home only for court hearings, meetings with his attorney, treatment or any other programming authorized by DOC.
Jury trial at 01-12-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Allen Cook in court with attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger.  Defendant Allen Cook in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- This matter is set on the jury trial calendar this afternoon and are requesting a brief adjournment.
Def- Objecting to the adjournment as this is the 2nd adjournment. Move the court to dismiss.
BTC: In 15CF696: $10,000 signature bond. Must reside at 3306 Lasalle Street Racine, WI. No drugs or alcohol with ZCI to monitor also placed on GPS monitoring. May leave home only for court hearings, meetings with his attorney, treatment or any other programming authorized by DOC. 
In 15CF511: $5,000 signature bond. Must reside at 3306 Lasalle Street Racine, WI. No drugs or alcohol with ZCI to monitor also placed on GPS monitoring. May leave home only for court hearings, meetings with his attorney, treatment or any other programming authorized by DOC.
